# summarize.etable { #pyfixest.summarize.etable }

`summarize.etable(models, digits=3, type='md')`

Create an esttab-like table from a list of models.

## Parameters

| Name     | Type   | Description                                                                                                     | Default    |
|----------|--------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `models` | list   | A list of models of type Feols, Feiv, Fepois.                                                                   | _required_ |
| `digits` | int    | Number of digits to round to.                                                                                   | `3`        |
| `type`   | str    | Type of output. Either "df" for pandas DataFrame, "md" for markdown, or "tex" for LaTeX table. Default is "md". | `'md'`     |

## Returns

| Type                    | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| pandas.pandas.DataFrame | A DataFrame with the coefficients and standard errors of the models. |

## Examples

```{python}
from pyfixest.estimation import feols
from pyfixest.utils import get_data
from pyfixest.summarize import etable

# load data
df = get_data()
fit1 = feols("Y~X1 + X2 | f1", df)
fit2 = feols("Y~X1 + X2 | f1 + f2", df)
fit3 = feols("Y~X1 + X2 | f1 + f2 + f3", df)

etable([fit1, fit2, fit3])
```
